page.title: 03RELIGION-Acomb Churches.
page.content: The oldest church in the village of Acomb is that of{St.Stephen.}It is probably Saxon but has been altered a lot.Its tall spire was added in 1830.The church has a large and interesting churchyard with several hundred gravestones,the oldest of which dates from 17th century. A second C.of E.church,{The Holy {Redeemer,}was built in 1937.The furniture and altar are made of oak and have the mouse trademark of Thompson of Kilburn carved on them.One wall of this church is made with Norman stone brought from a church demolished in the City Centre. { Lidgett Grove Methodist Chapel}was built in 1935 and a Roman Catholic church,the{Church of Our Lady,}was built in 1954.It has a parish which covers about 200 square miles.
